publicationStmt.p: TEI Exercise 1 for DIGIT 110, Penn State Behrend, Fall 2025

sourceDesc.p: This TEI file describes one of Mary Behrend's 1909 calendar sheets made for her husband.

div.head: January 30, 1909 – Saturday

figure.figDesc: Printed illustration of a person sitting up in bed, with a lamp and clock on a table nearby.

div.note: The handwriting appears in bold cursive writing with underlined words and flourishes. The paper is aged, with two punched holes at the top.

div.head: March 12, 1909 - Friday

figure.figDesc: Colored drawing of Molly wearing a dress clothes, skirt, and a hat walking on big snowshoes. She appears to be moving and has red and yellow details on the snowshoes.

div.note: Handwritten caption in pencil: “Molly on snowshoes that Mr. Weir got. Pretty picture is it not?!”
Red pen signature reads: “Love from Molly.”
The handwriting varies in color and medium — gray pencil for the main text and red pen for the signature. The decorated initial “M” at the top of the page is printed in black and pink ink.
